meanings.definition: A person or group that oppresses others.
meanings.sent1: The oppressor demanded more work from the workers.
meanings.sent2: The oppressor ruled the land with cruelty.
meanings.sent3: The oppressor tripped over his own greed.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadow of the oppressor loomed over the village.
meanings.sent5: The cries of the oppressed echoed louder than the footsteps of the oppressor.

meanings.definition: To crush or burden by abuse of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: Do not let anyone oppressor you into silence.
meanings.sent2: The dictator tried to oppressor the citizens into submission.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully tried to oppressor the students with homework.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility can oppressor the strongest of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds seemed to oppressor the entire sky with their darkness.
